III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• This consultant provided technical assistance to the facility about the
timeframe of when the fire inspection can be completed for renewal audit. The
facility should have a new fire inspection completed within the six months prior
to the license expiration date. This consultant also provided technical
assistance for Rule 400.4113 (e) as it pertains to references being completed
by related family members of potential employee. There was one employee file
found where their mother, was also a business owner with the employee, that
completed the reference which the rules state the references need to be
unrelated. The facility was not found in violation because the employee had
three other unrelated references completed. A reminder was just provided to
the administrative team about this rule.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultant provided feedback on CCI Rule 400.4113 (g) to have a clearer
narrative from the potential employee on their criminal history background if
there are convictions. The potential employee should provide more of a
narrative about the criminal convictions of what occurred, timeframe, and
growth.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
review period begins September 10, 2024, until current. The facility was granted
a 1st Provisional License on September 10, 2024. The facility had two special
investigations during the period under review with one resulting in a corrective
action plan (CAP) and one that remains pending. The special investigation that
resulted in a CAP was 2025SIC0000038 which resulted in finding a non-
compliance for staff pushing a youth back when a youth pushed them. The
approval of this CAP is still pending. Monthly unannounced visits to the facility

have been completed and implementation of their corrective action plans have
been noted.
The facility was placed on a 1st provisional license as a result of special
investigation 2024C0000983SI. This investigation was dated for 09/10/2024. The
action steps in this plan focused on clarification of allowable physical interaction
with youth. This included signed acknowledgements from staff, discussion during
staff meetings and coverage of the topic between staff and supervisors during
previously established one-on-one check ins. In addition, the staff member
involved in the incident covered in this SIR had their employment terminated. All
aspects of this CAP have been met as of this inspection.
Prior to the 1st provisional license there was two special investigations that
resulted in a CAP which were as followed:
• 2024C0001074SI was dated 04/11/2024. The action steps in this plan focused
on re-training of verbal de-escalation practices, reminders on applicable behavior
management policies and the creation of monthly check-in meetings between
staff and supervisors. The staff member involved in the incident covered in this
SIR had their employment terminated. All aspects of this CAP have been met as
of this inspection. Staff members interviewed intermittently over the course of
review of these action steps believed that the regular check-ins with management
had a positive effect on their work.
• 2024SIC0001450 was dated 09/05/2024. The action steps in this plan focused
on the discussion of proper physical interaction between youth and staff and
when that can be initiated by staff, as well as the usage of monthly check-ins
between staff and supervisors to discuss this further. The staff member involved
in this investigation was placed on a temporary leave and met with management
prior to return to address the incident and the proper use of proxemics when
interacting with escalated youth. This was verified by Licensing.
Following the 1st provisional license there was another two additional
investigations that resulted in a CAP which were as followed:
• 2024C0001137SI was dated 09/13/2024. The action steps in this plan clarified
facility policy prohibited prone restraints of youth as well as clarifying other
options for physical and behavioral management interventions. Staff have
reported clarification on how to respond to youth on the ground during a restraint.
All aspects of this CAP have been met as of this inspection.
• 2024SIC0001296 was dated 09/13/2024. The action step in this plan altered
facility policy and procedure regarding the timely receipt and response of
grievances filed by youth. All aspects of this CAP have been met as of this
inspection. Grievances filed by youth after this was implemented were all
responded to in a timely manner."

Overall, the facility has been within in CAP compliance and making sure they are
implementing all the action steps they have committed too. The facility is
completing monthly check in with staff. Supervisors are also reviewing with staff
during each supervision about proper physical management techniques and
reviewing with all staff on what agency action steps. The facility is well organized
with their documentation. During staff interviews for this inspection staff appeared
to be knowledgeable about their behavior management policy and proper
restraint techniques. The youth interviewed reporting feelings safe at the facility
and noting staff only restraint when youth are a danger to themselves or others.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
The facility PREA FACILITY Audit Report completed on 08/07/2024 was reviewed.
The facility met all PREA standards within this report.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The completed Chief Administrator Assessment was received and reviewed on
02/04/2025. Chief Administrator reported the one barrier that caused the rule
violations within the past was due to staff's ability to navigate the acting out
behavior by youth. In order to help support staff, there has been an increase in
one to one check ins with staff and scenarios-based trainings have occurred. The
increased supervision with staff has made a positive impact to where staff are
feeling more supported and having clearer communication on how to best support
the youth. The Chief Administrator reported the corrective action plans have been
working as intended. Staff are reminded on a more frequent basis on the physical
management policy, being mandated reporters and appropriate interactions with
youth.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Two direct care staff and one supervisor were interviewed during this inspection.
One direct care staff has recently been hired at the facility and reported the
training has been very beneficial. All the staff interviewed reported feeling well
supported by their direct supervisor and administration team. Staff did not report
any concerns during the interview and reported feeling well equipped to do their
jobs.

Three youth interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or
concerns were raised. The youth reported they feel safe at the facility and have a
positive relationship with staff. The reported staff are to always using verbal de-
escalation and only go hands on with a youth when they are a danger to
themselves or others. The youth at this facility appreciate staff transporting them
home for approved home visits and feel the facility is building them up to be
successful in their future.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on January 23,
2025. There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their regular
license.
